metadata.Description: Appropriate and independent oversight refers to the establishment of mechanisms or institutions that ensure accountability, transparency, and effective governance in various sectors, including the energy sector.

level 1.Description: Appropriate and independent oversight implements Energy Efficiency Policy to ensure its effective implementation and enforcement.
Appropriate and independent oversight monitors Energy Forecasting to ensure accurate and reliable energy predictions.
Appropriate and independent oversight collaborates with various partners to enhance the effectiveness of sustainable energy initiatives.
Appropriate and independent oversight supports the implementation of energy efficiency measures to reduce energy consumption and promote sustainability.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

level 2.Subject: energy forecasting
level 2.Description: Energy forecasting supports the integration of renewable energy sources by providing accurate predictions and forecasts.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.
